text: The Caracol River is a river in the state of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. It is a tributary of the Caí River. The Caracol River is known for the dramatic Caracol Falls, a major tourist attraction. The Caracol State Park, established in 1973, protects the environment around the falls. ==See also== *List of rivers of Rio Grande do Sul ==References== Category:Rivers of Rio Grande do Sul
title: Caracol River (Rio Grande do Sul)
